question: Hey Myra, why did you decide to go to Stanford?
prediction: I chose to go to Stanford because it has a strong reputation for academics and offers great opportunities for my future career.
answer: I wanted to go to Stanford to explore entrepreneurship and dive deeper into AI. In particular, I wanted to be around a startup ecosystem in Silicon Valley.

I went to Stanford to spend two years reflecting on what I want to do in my career long term. I wanted to find something mission aligned and to use AI for good, and knew that Stanford was the best place to figure it out.

I wanted to explore AI in the heart of Silicon Valley and figure out how to use technology for good. I wanted to be surrounded by top researchers and startups while also learning how to become a strong effective leader.

question: What do you want to do after you graduate?
prediction: I want to pursue a career in artificial intelligence research and development, with a focus on creating ethical and responsible AI systems
answer: I want to start my own company focused on how AI can be used responsibly and for good, or join an early stage startup on a mission to do the same. I want to work on something aligned with my values and purpose while leveraging my leadership and technical product skills.
Join a startup or start my own company focused on algorithmic bias and making models safe to use in production.

I want to figure out how to solve important social issues with the use of AI (e.g., criminal justice inequality) or combat algorithmic bias either through starting something myself or joining a startup aligned with these goals (eg Recidiviz)

question: What do you do in your free time?
prediction: In my free time, I enjoy reading books, going for hikes, and trying out new recipes in the kitchen
answer: I love spending time with friends, reading especilly fiction, going to the beach or on a hike, and trying yummy new food.
I love music, exercise and yoga, reading and trying new restaurants.
